quotes.quote: You build walls to fortify your heart,and blame on others for your loneliness.
Walls don't work instead of building walls to create security, we need to build bridges.
The wall that protects you, also imprisons you.
A piece of wall can be visually disintegrated from the whole into a separate triangle by plunging a diagonal of light from edge to edge on the wall; that is, side to floor, for instance.
The wall that protects you from rejection also keeps out love and success. Accept your abundance.
A person can put up any kind of protective wall, but love and truth always find a way around it.
There's a wall between you and what you want and you got to leap it.
The strength of walls depends on the courage of those who guard them.
Even paradise could become a prison if one had enough time to take notice of the walls.
The walls around us bear witness to lives past and present.
People are lonely because they build walls instead of bridges.
A wall is the safeguard of simplicity.
The only walls that exist are those you have placed in your mind. And whatever obstacles you conceive, exist only because you have forgotten what you have already achieved.
Sometimes you put walls up not to keep people out, but to see who cares enough to break them down.
A wall is a very big weapon. It's one of the nastiest things you can hit someone with.
Walls are made of fear; bridges are made of love!
The world is a stone wall and they have put the stones so close together that there is not a single crack through which one may enter.
Home is any four walls that enclose the right person.
Some people build walls, not to keep others out, but to see who cares enough to break them down. No many will.
The walls around the hood keep the people on the inside from the changes on the outside.
Brick walls let us prove how badly we want our dream and they stop those who don't want it enough. Brick walls let us show our dedication.
Walls are built up between people a hell of a damn sight faster than broken down.
A house is made of walls and beams; a home is built with love and dreams.
The walls we build around us to keep sadness out also keeps out the joy.
The only walls which bind us and stop us achieving our hearts desires are the walls we build for ourselves.
Walls protect and walls limit. It is in the nature of walls that they should fall. That walls should fall is the consequence of blowing your own trumpet.
The walls have ears, ears that hear each little sound you make every time you stamp, throw a lamp.
Obstacles are weak walls without foundations; if you fear them, they will defeat you. But the fact is that they are even afraid of you. So why frightened?
